perturbation.original_text:
2. Period of transportation services: this Agreement is valid for an indefinite term. Subsequent contracts might be entered in case of special
business.
perturbation.changed_text:
2. Period of transportation services: this Agreement is valid for an indefinite term. Subsequent contracts might be entered in case of special
business.

2.  (Alternate) Period of transportation services: This agreement is valid for a term of one year, automatically renewable for successive one-year terms unless either party provides written notice of termination at least 30 days prior to the end of the current term.
perturbation.explanation: The original clause states the agreement is for an indefinite term. The added clause introduces a contradictory term length of one year with automatic renewal, creating uncertainty about the actual duration of the agreement and conditions for termination.

perturbation.original_text:
10. Party B shall obtain Party A’s written consent in the case the early termination of the Agreement. Party B shall pay one-month freight as
liquidated damages in case of termination of the Agreement without consent. Within the contract period, Party B shall not charge the
freight difference if Party A rents same-level vehicles. Party B shall also compensate Party A’s other losses.
perturbation.changed_text:
10. Party B shall obtain Party A’s written consent in the case the early termination of the Agreement. Party B shall pay one-month freight as
liquidated damages in case of termination of the Agreement without consent. Within the contract period, Party B shall not charge the
freight difference if Party A rents same-level vehicles. Party B shall also compensate Party A’s other losses.

10. (Alternate) Notwithstanding the above, Party B may terminate this agreement at any time, for any reason, without penalty, by providing written notice to Party A.
perturbation.explanation: Section 10 initially requires Party B to obtain written consent from Party A for early termination and imposes a penalty for terminating without consent. The added clause contradicts this by stating that Party B can terminate at any time, for any reason, without penalty, creating ambiguity about the actual termination requirements and potential liabilities.

perturbation.original_text: 15. Any different interpretation of this Agreement by both Parties is subject to final interpretation by Party A.
perturbation.changed_text:
15. Any different interpretation of this Agreement by both Parties is subject to final interpretation by Party A.

15. (Alternate) In the event of any dispute regarding the interpretation of this agreement, both parties agree to submit to binding arbitration, and the arbitrator's decision shall be final and binding on both parties.
perturbation.explanation: The original clause grants Party A the final say in any differing interpretations of the agreement. The added clause mandates binding arbitration for dispute resolution, effectively removing Party A's unilateral power of interpretation. This creates a contradiction regarding the method for resolving interpretive disputes.
